MariaDB support comes to Rails 5! ğŸ‰

Thanks to Jeremy Daer, Ryuta Kamizono, Vipul A M and Ian Gilfillan, Active Record is now fully compatible with MariaDB â¤ï¸ğŸ’›ğŸ’šğŸ’œâ€¦ click on our heroesâ€™ names to open the commits and see what went down behind the scenes!

MariaDB is a community-developed open source fork of MySQL. Notable users include Wikipedia, Facebook, Google and, yes, Basecamp 3! Here is a good Wikipedia article about MariaDB and MySQL history. Game on!

Run Action Cable callbacks through the worker pool

Everybody out of the pool! ğŸŠ It was getting crowded in the water, but luckily our experienced Baywatch lifeguards Matthew, Sean and Jeremy ğŸ‹ were on hand to, er, pool their efforts to ensure your database connections are managed automatically when Action Cable is involved! Synchronized water ballet, anyone?

Fewer string allocations in number helpers

No Strings are better than NoSQL, right? Ankit noticed that the number_to_delimited and number_to_rounded helper methods were creating duplicate strings. Check out the pull request to see how he improved it using derailed_benchmarks to check object allocations ğŸ°

Speed up and handle max_time edge cases

Rails has the need for speed ğŸ’¨ and surfers Blake and Xavier managed a crowd-pleasing acceleration maneuver in AS::FileUpdateChecker using a single loop memoization rather than multiple loops, benchmarked using benchmark-ips. Itâ€™s good stuff; see the PR for more! ğŸ¦

Speed up attribute_changed? in ActiveModel::Dirty

Faster than relocating to San Francisco âœˆï¸ (and much more fun), sun-drenched rider Lihan was able to speed up attribute_changed? by setting the default options parameter to nil instead of a hash, and checking the result with benchmark-ips ğŸ˜

ğŸŒ´ Fixed ğŸŒ´

Disallow #deliver_later after local message modifications

Lifeguard Jeremy came across a common, hard-to-detect ğŸ in the water: Local message changes werenâ€™t being enqueued with the delivery job when using #deliver_later. This now raises a friendly exception to make sure your message modifications are made in either (a) the mailer method or (b) using a custom Active Job. Nice catch! ğŸŒŠ

Revert Hash#transform_keys to always return a Hash

While surfing Mongoidâ€™s test suite, an error alerted our champion Emily ğŸ„ğŸ¾ to a change of behavior in ActiveSupport#symbolize_keys: Rails 4.1 returned a Hash but 4.2/5.0 returned self.class. This launched an interesting discussion on the merits of expected behavior versus matching Rubyâ€™s behavior. Have a look! ğŸ
